basics.name: John Marczak
basics.label: Senior Full Stack Developer
basics.summary: Highly self-motivated, goal-oriented, professional committed to continuing a long-term career in web development and product engineering that offers the opportunity for career advancement along with the further expansion of IT skills.

work.name: Ecco Shoes
work.summary:
As a dedicated Full Stack Developer, I played a pivotal role in the success of a multinational organization, initially as a Front End Developer while working remotely from Connecticut, and later transitioning to an on-site role in the vibrant city of Copenhagen, Denmark. Throughout my tenure, I evolved into a versatile professional, contributing as a jack-of-all-trades across various areas.

  Key Contributions:

  Spearheaded the development of an innovative headless international multi-market e-commerce platform from the ground up, collaborating with a global team of talented developers. Involved in every phase, including architecture design, branching strategies, and implementation of Microsoft Azure infrastructure with Terraform for Infrastructure as Code (IaC).

  Orchestrated the setup and customization of essential tools and frameworks such as Node.js, JavaScript, TypeScript, and Deno. Implemented commitizen for quality commit messages, ES and TS lint for linting, Husky for git hooks, and NVM for efficient node version management.

  Leveraged cutting-edge technologies including Docker, Netlify, and GitHub pipelines for CI/CD, testing, and branch-based preview deployments. Implemented comprehensive testing strategies and frameworks, utilizing tools like Jest, Playwright, Postman, Newman, and GitHub Actions.

 Ensured high security standards by implementing Static Application Security Testing (SAST) through SonarQube, while actively participating in the overall security aspects of the project.

 Employed monitoring and observability tools like Datadog to maintain a stable and performant platform, enabling swift identification and resolution of potential issues.

 Collaborated closely with cross-functional teams, incorporating design systems using Figma and Chakra UI, and building monorepos with TurboRepo.

 Integrated key headless and SaaS tools such as Algolia for search functionality, commercetools for efficient product data management, Adyen for secure payments, and Contentful for content management.

  Utilized modern front-end frameworks like ReactJS and Next.js, coupled with back-end technologies such as NestJS and a custom GraphQL API for content and translation services.

 Actively participated in the transition to an agile methodology, leveraging tools like Jira and Confluence to optimize project management and collaboration.

 Promoted to the role of Tech Lead for a B2B platform, taking charge of architectural design and implementation on Azure infrastructure. Led the development of CI/CD pipelines and utilized a range of technologies including Postgres, Socket.IO, Redis, Next.js, Swagger, JWT, Passport, TypeORM, SendGrid, and Azure SSO, alongside an Angular front end.
work.summary2: Started as a front end developer at this wonderful company remote from CT and later relocated the the amazing city of Copenhegan Denmark and switched to more of a full stack, jack of all trades contributor. I was hired during one of the first round of hires as consultants where heavily involved. I was also involved in the hiring process and onboarding of new developers and worked with a global team of talented developers to build a new headless international multi market ecommerce platform from the ground up. I was lucky enough to be involved in everything from architecture, branching strategies, building Microsoft Azure infrastructure with terrafrom for IaC (Infrastructure as Code), Docker development, Netlify hosting, edge functions, and branch based preview deployments, github pipelines for CI/CD and testing, testing strategies and frameworks, SAST (SonarQube) and security, Datadog for monitoring, etc.. At the begining I helped setup and customized tools for nodejs, javascript, typescript, and Deno like commitizen for quality commit messages, linting tools like es and ts lint, Husky for git hooks, NVM for node version management, etc.. We used tools like Figma and helped build design systems with Chakra UI and used ReactJS and Storybook with Chakra-UI and setup monorepos with turborepo. Tools like Jest, Playwright, Postman and Newman, and Github Actions were put in place for testing. Headless and SASS tools like Algolia for search, commercetools for product data, Adyen payment, contentful for content and others where integrated from the start to build custom storefronts able to be deployed to many different markets with different items available, taxes, prices,currencies, and consumers, etc.. Front end was built primarily with React and Nextjs and a backend with NestJS and a custom GraphQL API to manage content and translation services. I was also involved in and contributed to the move to agile and used tools like Jira and Confluence.I was also transitioned to a tech lead on a B2B platform and involved in the architecture and design built on Azure infrastructure and helped build the CI/CD pipelines. using things like Postgres, socket.io, reddis, NextJS, swagger, JWT, passport, typeORM, sendgrid, Azure SSO, with an Angular front end.

work.name: Synacor
work.summary: Full stack developer with a focus on nodejs and javascript using vanila javascript, Preact, and Vue, also worked with golang and PHP for backend with AWS infrastructure.

work.name: Adams & Knight
work.summary: Designed, developed, and consumed RESTful APIs used to rate home and auto insurance from carriers, display ads, get rate and policy information, and schedule call backs to users while collecting analytic and attribution data. Built and debugged both functional and stress tests with Node.js, MySQL, MongoDB and Redis cached back end. Developed ReactJS, Vue, and other MVC framework front ends with vanilla API wrapper to ease the usage for other developers and demo the back ends. Automated tasks using Grunt/Gulp/yeoman/etc. as well as jsdoc to create living documentation. Containerized application micro services to quickly stand up environments for developers and automated CI/CD delivery and deployment with GIT flow following agile methodologies. Created several automation's for releases, change logs, etc. used GitHub actions to continuously develop and deliver AWS web services and orchestration. Participated in security audits and administration. Maintained several companies front end web facing sites and other misc. web related projects. More details available upon request.

work.name: Travelers
work.position: Full Stack Developer / Visual Data Analytics Engineer Specialist
work.summary:
Worked with business Intelligence and Analytics Innovation/AI team under limited supervision as the entry point for evaluating new technologies and writing proof of concept applications using multiple technologies, languages, frameworks, and methodologies for use cases and assessed the impact or opportunity on business capabilities. Quickly learned to effectively be a subject matter expert for assigned applications, systems, services, data and technologies. Actively helped implement and  participate in the plan, design, and build process with a focus on Agile and eventual continuous integration. 

Each project was a new PoC or enhancement usually using completely different stacks, frameworks, and languages to meet the needs. Introduced Docker and containers to the team to show them environments on demand.
    • Utilized multiple stacks for PoC, evaluation, and extension/integration’s
        ◦ Built several front-end solutions and web components with several frameworks (React, Polymer) to using JavaScript, Babel, and  Typescript. Also built several reusable Qlik extensions for end users to consume REST APIs, create maps with ESRI, charts D3 and other frameworks, as well as HTML5 audio speech recognition and synthesis.
        ◦ Built several server-side micro-service architecture projects using docker and docker-compose to build networked environments for things like Kafka, Hadoop, zookeeper, spark, etc., as well as nodejs and mongodb for simpler projects.
        ◦ Utilized modern technologies to build and adopt tooling, generators, automation, packaging/bundling such as nodejs, npm, yeoman, express, Bower/Slush, Grunt/Gulp, CSS/LESS/SCSS/SASS, GIT, Git Flow, and Jenkins. 
        ◦ Helped implement agile methodologies and processes, utilizing scrum ceremonies, including Sprint Planning, Grooming, and Retros, Daily Stand-ups, etc.

work.name: People's United Bank, N.A.
work.summary:
Lead the design, development, and configuration of integrations to implement Salesforce and Supported integrations. Built Supported infrastructure, continuous integration, agile implementation, version control, and processes to support a large implementation and adoption of Salesforce. Provided leadership and direction to software development team members and third-party integration solutions and worked with business leaders, architects and project managers to facilitate the development of business solutions. Directed application development efforts, mentored team members.

Provided logic specification and code design. Lead application architecture concepts and programming techniques while adhering to documented standards and policies including the Project Life Cycle (PLC), Application Change Management (ACM) and System Development Lifecycle (SDLC). Supported the full testing cycle including: independent unit testing, system integration testing with internal IT departments or outside vendors, and user acceptance testing. Participated in UAT triage sessions, as needed and assisted in triage and production Help Desk tickets. Provided estimates for Business Change Requests and reviews estimates made by application development members. Acted as Build/Configuration Manager to ensure proper compiling and ultimate distribution of internally developed applications while ensuring compliance with documented policies and d adhering to compliance and internal/operational risk controls in accordance with any and all applicable regulatory standards, requirements, and policies.

work.name: eVariant
work.summary:
Senior product developer of secure, compliant, reliable, scalable healthcare SaaS applications spanning environments from salesforce, LAMP, angular and nodejs, Hadoop ecosystem, mostly focused on javascript UI/UX development. Also setup and configured VCS such as git and bitbucket with tools like docker(docker-compose) and AWS, and continuous integration software products such as phabricator, JIRA, Teamcity and more. 

Currently primarily working with aura (salesforce web components  https://github.com/forcedotcom/aura similar to polymer) to provide a front end with reusable components as well as supporting the team and supporting legacy products.  

Legacy products involved working on full stack PHP applications for salesforce canvas and SOAP and REST APIs in Linux that connect to IBM Netezza, Postgres and with vanilla javascript and other frameworks that are displayed working with twitter bootstrap.

work.name: Travelers Insurance (TEK Systems)
work.summary: UI/UX development with a large team of talented professionals on the cutting edge of JavaScript development developing an internal web application for agents. Utilizing the jquery JavaScript framework and extending it with prototype and closures to produce a custom application highly focused on JavaScript. Utilizing the agile software development methodology in a C# .net environment with several large teams including one off shore. Testing with WatiN and YUI and using subversion version control system.

work.name: The Music People! Inc.
work.summary:
Work with management and design directives to integrate specific ERP system with custom catalog management software to create an API, websites, and other applications. Systems run on different stacks and and are converted and synchronized to LAMP stack for end user products.

General IT work as well as inter office scripting support for desktops, image manipulation and other misc projects.

work.name: New Wave Industries
work.summary: Lead web developer. Developing AJAX, PHP, MySQL, ASP, ASP.NET, Javascript, XML, CSS, Prototype and  Scriptaculous  web applications

work.name: Robert Half Tech.
work.summary: Web Development on contract. PHP/MySQL, javascript, xhtml, css, etc

work.name: Milestone Multimedia
work.summary: Lead web developer / video editor. Designed and developed all sites for clients and oversaw other employees...

work.name: Innervision Inc
work.summary: General computer and network troubleshooting as well as Microsoft servers.

work.name: Center for Learning
work.summary:
Instructed students on web design and development to get Certified Internet Webmaster certifications, as well as photoshop and A+/N+ classes.

Designed and developed simple brochure style sites and content management systems for clients.

General home user hardware/software support.

references.name: Achref Thamri
references.reference: John consistently exhibits an invaluable combination of being helpful and remarkably insightful. His willingness to lend a hand, offer guidance, and share their expertise has been instrumental in others' success. His ability to offer practical solutions with a thoughtful approach makes him an asset in any collaborative setting.

references.name: Mikkel Möller-Lindkvist
references.reference:
John is a highly skilled developer, with one of the best attitudes I’ve encountered in my career. 

John manages to tackle any challenge with positivity and realism, while having communicating at all times. Something that’s highly valuable in a business with rapid change. John asks the important questions, and prioritizes the Users and the vision instead of what’s fastest or shortest.
John is also a great person and an empathetic person, who will positively impact any team he joins.

references.name: Eric Tully
references.reference: John and I worked together for three years on a difficult and frustrating project and we delivered a product we were proud of.  Be clear on this:  That project would not have been successful without John's optimism, work ethic, sincerity, and willingness to investigate new technologies.  John is genuine.  I'm proud to know him, to have worked with him, and I will be a part of any development team for the opportunity to work with him again.

references.name: Jean Louis
references.reference: John has been a wonderful colleague to work with. He is a very strong developer and has been very helpful to me in the 4 years we’ve worked together.  His technical skills and hard work ethic will add value to any team. I highly recommend John.

references.name: David Emmerthal
references.reference: John is a high skilled developer with passion for open source technologies, specifically in the LAMP stack. He is eager to stay on the cutting edge and utilize the most efficient technologies to solve problems. I enjoyed my time working with him and hope I get the chance to do so again!

references.name: Allison McHenry
references.reference: I managed John on a large and complex independent project, co-writing a PHP-based custom content management system for a small publishing company. John was always prompt, courteous, well-prepared, and an excellent developer. I would be happy to recommend his work to any potential employer.

references.name: Victor Sklutovsky
references.reference: John is an excellent addition to any organization that needs a skilled developer. I've seen John show his vigilance in JavaScript, PHP, MySQL and various other web platforms and technologies. When it comes to something new to him, he is quick to pick it up and apply in context of his experience - Salesforce and Eloqua being the prime examples. He helped me numerous times when I needed his expertise, and his developer mindset allowed for very productive collaboration between us regarding everything from logic to user interface on various projects. When not on a project, John seeks ways to improve process and develops applications that help internal and external users do their jobs more efficiently.

references.name: Geza Czako
references.reference: I have hired John on many occasions on projects of various sizes and scopes.  John has always been punctual, professional, and very knowledgeable.  I have had some issues with other providers in the past, but John was able to dig right in pickup what they did incorrectly and make my projects a success.  He has always been and continues to be an incredible asset.

references.name: Pallav L
references.reference:
“John is an extremely intelligent and dedicated person. When he takes up a work, then he makes it a point to complete it..He has a great sense of humour.. team player and a go getter..With a cool temperament, I reacon he can be a great person to work with.. 
Wishing you all the success in future..”

references.name: John Hennessey
references.reference:
John is a very well rounded web developer with unique technical skills.  I would highly recommend John.  He is very capable and hard working.  He was very helpful troubleshooting complex issues, often times outside his primary responsibilities.  He created many new systems from concept to implementation that involved all the different aspects of development from the user interface to the back-end database and all the logic in between.

I recommend John as he is a great asset to any IT team.
